questiontext.text: Which of the following statements relating to accounting for a partnership is true?

generalfeedback.text:
The following is GenAI explanations, use with caution.
Option C is correct because in a partnership maintaining fixed capital accounts, the capital account balance remains constant and only changes when capital is introduced or withdrawn (retirement). Share of profits, interest on capital, and drawings are recorded in the Current Accounts, not Capital Accounts (making A and D incorrect). A loan from a partner is treated as a liability (loan account), not capital (making B incorrect).

answer.text: The partners' capital accounts reflect each partner's share of profit from the appropriation account

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements relating to accounting for a partnership is true?

generalfeedback.text:
The following is GenAI explanations, use with caution.
Option A is correct because the share of residual profit determined in the appropriation account is credited to the partners' current accounts. Option B is incorrect because partnership salaries are an appropriation of profit, not an expense in the P&L. Option C is incorrect because interest on capital is credited to the current account, not the fixed capital account. Option D is incorrect because partners can contribute different amounts of capital.

answer.text: The respective share of profit from the appropriation account is recorded in the current account of each partner.
If a partner has a salary from the partnership, this is accounted for as an expense in the statement of profit or loss.
If interest is earned on capital account balances, the interest earned is credited to the capital account of each partner.
The capital account balances of each partner must have identical account balances.

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements provides the definition of a partnership?

generalfeedback.text:
The following is GenAI explanations, use with caution.
Option B is correct as it captures the essence of a partnership: a relationship between persons carrying on a business in common with a view of profit. Option A is incorrect as partnerships can have more than three partners. Options C and D describe employees or separate sole traders, not a partnership entity.

answer.text: A maximum of three people in business together
Persons in business together with the intention of sharing profits and losses
Two work colleagues who are employed by the same business
Two persons who each have their own business as a sole proprietor

questiontext.text: What is the purpose of a partnership agreement?

generalfeedback.text:
The following is GenAI explanations, use with caution.
Option C is the best description; the agreement is a contract governing the internal relationship, rights, and duties of partners. Option A is incorrect because a written agreement is not strictly legally required (partnerships can exist under general partnership acts). Option B is incorrect as it is an internal document. Option D is partially true but too narrow compared to C, which encompasses all rights and responsibilities.

answer.text: It is a legal requirement for all partnerships to have a partnership agreement.
It enables customers to understand how the partnership operates.
It is a contract between the partners that sets out their rights and responsibilities to each other.
It is a contract between the partners that sets out the profit and loss sharing arrangements between the partners.

questiontext.text: Which of the following items would not normally be included within a partnership agreement?

generalfeedback.text:
The following is GenAI explanations, use with caution.
Option D is correct. The names of customers and suppliers are operational business data, not constitutional details required in the partnership agreement. The agreement focuses on the partners' relationship (A, B) and the firm's identity (C).

answer.text: The names of the partners
The arrangements for sharing residual profits and losses between the partners
The name and business location of the partnership
The names of the principal customers and suppliers of the business

questiontext.text:
Viv and Bao are in partnership, sharing profits and losses in a ratio of 3:2. The business maintains current accounts and fixed capital accounts for the partners. In the last year, the profit before appropriations was $27,800. Bao is entitled to an annual salary of $3,800.
During the year Viv and Bao made cash drawings of $12,000 each.

What is Viv's share of the profit?

generalfeedback.text:
The following is GenAI explanations, use with caution.
Net Profit: $27,800
Less Bao's Salary: ($3,800)
Residual Profit: $24,000
Viv's Share (3/5 of $24,000): $14,400.

questiontext.text: The correct entry for the partners' drawings has been made in the cash account. What entry is needed to complete the posting for the partners' drawings?

generalfeedback.text:
The following is GenAI explanations, use with caution.
Drawings represent a reduction in the partners' equity and are recorded by debiting the partners' current accounts (since capital accounts are fixed). The corresponding credit is to cash (which is already done).

answer.text: A debit entry in the partners' capital accounts
A credit entry in the partners' capital accounts
A debit entry in the partners' current accounts
A credit entry in the partners' current accounts

Salary 6,500

generalfeedback.text:

questiontext.text:
Hub Design has three partners: M, J and A. The three share profits equally after interest on capital at 5% and J's partnership salary of $8,000. The partners' account balances are shown below:
MJATotal
Capital$20,000$15,000$40,000$75,000
Current$100,000$80,000$110,000$290,000
Drawings$30,000$35,000$40,000$105,000

No interest is paid on current account balances.
The net profit for the year ended 31 December 20X6 is $170,000.


What will the statement of financial position as at 31 December 20X6 show as the total for owners' equity?{2:NUMERICAL:=430000:0}
What will each partner receive as a share of residual profit?{2:NUMERICAL:=52750:0}
What total profit will J receive for the year ended 31 December 20X6?{2:NUMERICAL:=61500:0}

generalfeedback.text:
The following is GenAI explanations, use with caution.
Owners' Equity: Opening Capital ($75,000) + Opening Current ($290,000) + Profit ($170,000) - Drawings ($105,000) = $430,000.
Residual Profit: Net Profit $170,000 - J's Salary $8,000 - Interest on Capital (5% of 75,000 = 3,750) = $158,250. Share per partner (equal split): 158,250 / 3 = $52,750.
J's Total Profit: Salary $8,000 + Interest on Capital (5% of 15,000 = $750) + Share of Residual $52,750 = $61,500.

What was Kranti's total share of the profit for the year to 31 August 20X3?

generalfeedback.text:
The following is GenAI explanations, use with caution.
The answer provided ($51,324) is calculated as Salary ($18,000) + $33,324. Note that $33,324 corresponds to 3/5 of the residual profit ($73,540 - $18,000 = $55,540). The question text states Kranti's ratio is 2:3 (implying 2/5 share), but the key matches a 3/5 share calculation.
